channel.description: Recent content in heatmap on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] [Python] Calendar-type heat map (with holiday display)
item.description: # Purpose of this article Create a heat map in calendar format with holidays as shown below. By the way, in the data, the post date of @yaotti’s post acquired using Qiita API is used as 1 post = 1 event. Similar visualization method Contributions Calendar Contribution Graph Grass grass Although it is called with various names, the following figure on GitHub is also simple and good.

item.title: [Python] [Visualization with folium] I feel that the number of family members has increased too much in recent years
item.description: This is the 21st day article of [MYJLab Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/myjlab).Thatchwillbeincharge.(Sorryforthedelay) This time what to do Recently, there is a phenomenon that there is a FamilyMart on the other side of the road across my road. In order to visualize this phenomenon, I would like to drop the increase in the number of FamilyMart stores in the time series heat map for each prefecture. What to use There is a library called Leaflet that can draw nice maps with JavaScript.
